front.title: Combiner function for hybrid key encapsulation mechanisms (Hybrid KEMs)

abstract.t: The migration to post-quantum cryptography often calls for performing multiple key encapsulations in parallel and then combining their outputs to derive a single shared secret. This document defines a comprehensible and easy to implement Keccak- based KEM combiner to join an arbitrary number of key shares, that is compatible with NIST SP 800-56Cr2 [SP800-56C] when viewed as a key derivation function. The combiners defined here are practical multi- PRFs and are CCA-secure as long as at least one of the ingredient KEMs is.
